package.name: Solar
package.summary: Simple object library and application repository for PHP.
package.description:
Solar is a class library and application component suite for PHP 5 (and is PHP5 E_STRICT compliant). Solar provides simple, easy-to-comprehend classes and components for the common aspects of web-based rapid application development.
Solar is designed for developers who intend to distribute their applications to the whole world. This means, for example, the database driver functions work exactly the same way for each supported database. It also means that localization support is built in from the start.
Please visit http://solarphp.com/ for more information.
package.notes:
* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* REQUIREMENTS: You need to be running PHP 5.1RC1 (exactly) for this release to work for you; this is because of the new PDO-based SQL classes. RC3 **will not** work because they changed the constants; a followup release of Solar will address this.
* BACKWARDS COMPATIBILITY: There are major BC breaks in this release, particularly in the Solar_Sql classes, along with those classes related to and depending upon Solar_Sql.
* Removed classes:
* Solar_Sql_Entity: it has been refactored into Solar_Sql_Select, Solar_Sql_Table, and Solar_Form_Load_Table.
* Solar_Super: it pretty much did one thing, strip_tags() from GET vars. With the new escaping in Savant3, it's not really needed any more. Folded the default-value functionality into Solar.php as super().
* Solar_App_Bugs: these classes will reappear after I convert the app to the new Solar_Sql PDO-based system, and revamp the MVC structure of Solar_App.
* Solar_Cell_Bugs: probably will not reappear as a Cell because it isn't generic enough; instead, it will reappear as a model class within Solar_App_Bugs
* Added classes:
* Solar_Sql_Select to build Select statements
* Solar_Sql_Table to act as a Table Data Gateway (auto-creates tables as well)
* Solar_Form_Load_Table to auto-create forms from Solar_Sql_Table schemas
* Solar:
* Fixed bug where environment() method was not static (thanks Adrian Gheorghe)
* Solar_App_Bookmarks:
* Updated to use new Solar_Cell_Bookmarks
* You will need to migrate your old bookmarks to the new table, see migrate/0.8.0-0.9.0/convert_bookmarks.php
* You will need to change your QuickMark link to the new one (the "title" variable is now called "subj")
* Added some view candy, e.g. the tag list shows the number of times the tag appears
* Added localization for the "order by" links
* Solar_Base:
* Added errorException() method to convert exceptions to Solar_Error objects
* Now loads the locale file at __construct() time instead of on first call to locale()
* Solar_Cell_Bookmarks:
* MAJOR BC BREAK, many method names have changes
* Now based on new Solar_Content model
* Solar_Form:
* Added orderElements() method to set elements into arbitrary order
* Changed all 'validate' keys to 'valid' in all Form classes for consistency with locale and table classes
* Solar_Filter:
* Removed deprecated alphanumeric() method; use identical alnum() instead
* Solar_Sql:
* MAJOR BC BREAK: The SQL classes are now based on PDO, and there are major shifts in how the the SQL class works.
* Changed default driver class to Sqlite
* Changed default host to 127.0.0.1 (PDO doesn't like 'localhost')
* Changed exec() to query() to be more in line with PDO API
* added select() return type 'pdo' to return the PDOStatement object
* changed select() return type 'result' to return a Solar_Sql_Result object
* changed default select() return type to assign to $config['PDOStatement'] instead of $config['result']
* Added quoteInto() and quoteMulti() methods
* update() and delete() now take arrays as WHERE clauses, and pass through quoteMulti() automatically
* quote() now allows you to specify a separator string for quoted arrays converted to strings
* Solar_Sql_Driver:
* Complete BC break
* Converted to PDO usage
* Transaction support, but autocommit by default
* select-statement creation now adds tabs and newlines in column list (vice a literal \n\t)
* select-statement creation now separates FROM list by comma only (no tabs or newlines)
* fixed bug in select-statement creation JOIN implode() (wrong params)
* added transaction support methods begin(), commit(), and rollback()
* Solar_Sql_Driver_Mysql:
* Now uses InnoDB tables now (vice MyISAM) to support transactions. You'll need MySQL 4.0 or higher for this.
* Solar_Sql_Driver_Mssql:
* buildSelect() now uses smarter (but untested) LIMIT offset emulation, also takes DISTINCT into account
* Solar_Sql_Select:
* now maps columns to from/join names for deconfliction later
* from() and join() now allow you specify which columns to select
* from() and join() now allow the option to specify a table object (instead of a table name)
* fetch() automatically deconflicts columns between tables/joins when they were added via from()/join()
* updated countPages() method to take new deconfliction into account
* Solar_Sql_Result:
* complete BC break
* converted to new PDO usage
* auto-maps deconflicted colnames to arrays: looks at colnames for __ and converts to arrays on fetch()
* Solar_Sql_Table:
* automatically adds 'id' column, index, and sequence
* automatically adds 'created' column and index
* automatically adds 'updated' column and index
* insert() automatically sets 'created' and 'updated' timestamps
* update() automatically sets 'updated' timestamp
* Solar_Valid:
* Removed deprecated alphanumeric(); use identical alnum() instead
* Added mimeType() method for MIME types
* Added sepWords() method for spearated word strings
* Improved uri() method

release.notes:
* WARNING: This is a public development release, and is not yet stable.
* REQUIREMENTS: You need to be running PHP 5.1RC1 (exactly) for this release to work for you; this is because of the new PDO-based SQL classes. RC3 **will not** work because they changed the constants; a followup release of Solar will address this.

* Solar_Sql_Select to build Select statements
